intro: Triumfetta morrumbalana, commonly known as the African glorybower, is a shrub native to southern Africa. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes hibiscus and cotton plants. The plant is characterized by its showy, trumpet-shaped flowers that range in color from yellow to orange. It thrives in well-drained soils and is often found in rocky or coastal areas. The leaves are alternate, ovate, and have a rough texture, while the stems are often woody and branched.
